article.headline: Gardner-Webb 71, W. Carolina 65
article.story: WILLIAMSBURG, Va. -- Jon Moore hit 7 of 8 free throws in the final 34 seconds in Gardner-Webb's come-from-behind, 71-65 victory over Western Carolina on Saturday in the Legends Classic. The Runnin' Bulldogs (4-3), who had lost two straight games and three of their previous four, overcame a 17-point deficit. Trailing 25-8 with 10:26 left in the first half, Gardner-Webb tied the score at 37 a second before halftime on Santoine Butler's three-point play. In the second half, the Runnin' Bulldogs led by eight, but the Catamounts (2-4) closed to 64-61 on a Mike Williams 3-pointer with 1:01 left. Moore's four trips to the free-throw line were enough to hold off Western Carolina, which has lost three of its last four. Laron Buggs also scored 12 for Gardner-Webb, while Mike Byron and Josh Henley had 10 apiece. Williams led the Catamounts with 24 points and Trey Sumler added 12.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
